Speak with the Namazu procurer.

Mol Iloh<hex:FF34>Deliver <hex:02310CFF05>Item<hex:03E806030203> to Seigetsu the Enlightened<hex:03><hex:FF70><hex:02086CE4E80513FF64><hex:020860E3E802E803FF24>Catch <hex:02310CFF05>Item<hex:02E806020203> at Azim Khaat<hex:FF34>Deliver <hex:02310CFF05>Item<hex:03E806020203> to Seigetsu the Enlightened<hex:03><hex:FF01><hex:03><hex:03><hex:03><hex:03><hex:03><hex:03><hex:03><hex:03><hex:03><hex:03><hex:03>.

<hex:022C0DFF07><hex:022903EB0203><hex:FF02> <hex:0203>, I have a special favor to ask of you. Our altar has frequent need of fresh offerings─fish, fruit, and the like─and we require your assistance in procuring replacements. But these must be no ordinary offerings...

Our head procurer will provide you with the details of your task─you will find him absorbed in his work near the Path of the Craven. ...Oh, and <hex:022C0DFF07><hex:022903EB0203><hex:FF02> <hex:0203>? Pray keep this request confidential, if you would.
Seigetsu sent you, yes, yes? Thank the Big One! I need an expert─a veteran in the field─to handle one of the more challenging aspects of the procurement.
To be more specific, I need you to craft a high-quality metal fish sculpture for our altar offerings. As convincingly real as possible! Feel free to raid my supply crate for anything you need.
To be more specific, I need you to craft a high-quality imitation flower for our altar offerings. As convincingly real as possible! Feel free to raid my supply crate for anything you need.
To be more specific, I need you to craft a high-quality hot pepper ball. As excruciatingly spicy as possible! Feel free to raid my supply crate for anything you need.

To be more specific, I need you to mine some pieces of jade that could be mistaken for kusamochi─you know those green-colored rice cake treats? The all-knowing Seigetsu mentioned deposits are to be found to the east of Mol Iloh.

To be more specific, I need you to harvest some wild steppe radishes─I hear they feel like hot coals on your tongue. According to Seigetsu and his infallible research, such peppery vegetables can be found growing in the east of Mol Iloh.

To be more specific, I need you to locate some salmon roe and use it to catch me a spikefish from the waters of Azim Khaat. They say the locals usually cut this one free, seeing as it's more bone than fish...
Once you have my request in order, please deliver it straight to Dhoro Iloh. I'll bring the rest to Seigetsu myself...if I ever manage to find everything on this infernal list.
As I said, feel free to raid my supply crate there if you find yourself lacking any materials. Pillage away!
As I said, feel free to raid my supply crate there if you find yourself lacking any materials. Pillage away!
As I said, feel free to raid my supply crate there if you find yourself lacking any materials. Pillage away!
The crate appears to be filled to the brim with sundry materials─none of which you require at this time.
The crate appears to be filled to the brim with sundry materials─none of which you require at this time.
The crate appears to be filled to the brim with sundry materials─none of which you require at this time.
The crate appears to be filled to the brim with sundry materials─none of which you require at this time.
You sift through the cornucopia of crafting materials and retrieve all you require for your work.
You sift through the cornucopia of crafting materials and retrieve all you require for your work.
You sift through the cornucopia of crafting materials and retrieve all you require for your work.
Once you have those jade pieces, I'd appreciate it if you could take them directly to Seigetsu. Yes, yes.
Once you have those steppe radishes, I'd appreciate it if you could take them directly to Seigetsu. Yes, yes.
Once you've caught that spikefish, I'd appreciate it if you could take it directly to Seigetsu. Yes, yes.
All set? Let's get our offerings to Seigetsu, and remember: not a word to anyone! No, no!
You have my “special consignment”?
Most excellent. You see, there is a reason we have needed to replace our altar offerings with such frequency. Shall I enlighten you as to why?
Thieves. A certain number of ill-natured and gluttonous Namazu have been stuffing their faces with our festival fare.
Thus did I requisition the creation of such offerings that would fill the bellies of these voracious vandals with naught but remorse. A civilized solution, do you not agree?

But even the average Namazu is unrepentant in his appetite! No matter how many are repulsed by our culinary artifice, there will always be another tempted by the prospect of a surreptitious snack! We must stand ready to restock our supply...
Normal-quality items crafted in the course of this quest serve no purpose and cannot be sold. It is recommended that you discard them.
